abstract.text: Initializes an array of vImage buffers in the order necessary to copy to a Core Video pixel buffer.

The vImage library represents multiple plane Core Video pixel buffers as individual vImage buffers. Call
to instantiate the correct number of destination buffers. Use this function to initialize the vImage buffers that you pass as the destinations to a Core-Video-to-Core-Graphics
The following shows the code for creating the three destination buffers required to represent a
, the three vImage buffers contain the luminance, Cb, and Cr image data.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A flag that prevents vImage from allocating additional storage.
The vImage function completed without error.
Initializes an array of vImage buffers in the order necessary to copy from a Core Video pixel buffer.
Initializes an array of vImage buffers in the order necessary to copy to a Core Video pixel buffer.
Converts the pixels in a vImage buffer to another format, using the specified converter.
A description of a conversion from one image format to another.
Returns the number of destination buffers written to by the converter.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A reference to a Core Video pixel buffer object.
Locks the base address of the pixel buffer.
Unlocks the base address of the pixel buffer.
Planar Component Y’CbCr 8-bit 4:2:0. `baseAddr` points to a big-endian `CVPlanarPixelBufferInfo_YCbCrPlanar` struct.
A reference to a Core Video pixel buffer object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
